meta.dc:rights: The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation—
subsection.def: active (生效狀態), in relation to a SIM card, means that the person to whom a service is supplied through the SIM card is for the time being able to access the service through the SIM card;
body (團體) means a body of persons, corporate or unincorporate, whether or not established in Hong Kong;

correct (改正), in relation to any information, means to make a correction (as defined by section 2(1) of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486)), in compliance with a data correction request, to any personal data comprising the information;

current specified information (現有指明資料), in relation to an eligible person, means the specified information of the person provided for the registration of a SIM card for the person under section 6 (as the information may be corrected from time to time);
data correction request (改正資料要求) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486);
guidelines (指引) means the guidelines issued under section 14;

def.name: LawEnforcementOfficer
def.leadIn: law enforcement officer (執法人員) means an officer of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Customs and Excise Department;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Police Force;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Immigration Department; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Independent Commission Against Corruption;

subsection.def: mobile device (流動裝置) means a piece of electronic equipment that can be used for accessing a mobile telecommunications service provided by a specified licensee, such as a mobile phone or tablet computer;
personal data (個人資料) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486);
pre-paid SIM card (儲值卡) means a SIM card that is not a service plan SIM card;

def.name: ServicePlanSIMCard
def.leadIn: service plan SIM card (服務計劃卡) means a SIM card, that is provided by a specified licensee to a person, through which a service is supplied or to be supplied where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person may make payment (or part of the payment) for the service after the service is used in full or in part; and

paragraph.name: b

def.name: SIMCard
def.leadIn: SIM card (用户識別卡) means a subscriber identification module provided by a specified licensee that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forms part of a mobile device, or is a hardware or software component for insertion into or integration with a mobile device;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is represented or held out by the licensee to be used primarily for communications between persons and persons; and

paragraph.name: c

def.name: SIMCardRecord
def.leadIn: SIM card record (用户識別卡紀錄)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a record that is kept by a specified licensee in respect of a SIM card under section 11; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes a record that is taken to be a SIM card record under section 18(5);

subsection.def: specified information (指明資料), in relation to an eligible person, means the information specified in the Schedule for that person;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the holder of a unified carrier licence, or mobile carrier licence, as defined by section 2(1) of the Telecommunications (Carrier Licences) Regulation (Cap. 106 sub. leg. V);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the holder of a services-based operator licence issued under section 7(5) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c

subsection.def: valid branch registration certificate (有效分行登記證) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310), but excludes a duplicate branch registration certificate within the meaning of that Ordinance;

valid business registration certificate (有效商業登記證) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310), but excludes a duplicate business registration certificate within the meaning of that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Regulation, a SIM card is currently registered with a specified licensee for an eligible person if the SIM card—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been registered under section 6 with the licensee for the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been deregistered under Part 3 afterwards.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Meaning of certain expressions relating to telecommunications service

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Regulation, a specified licensee is to be regarded as offering a telecommunications service if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the licensee makes an offer which, if accepted, would give rise to an agreement, arrangement or understanding for the provision of a telecommunications service by—

subparagraph.content: the licensee; or
another person with whom the licensee has made an arrangement for the provision of the telecommunications service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licensee invites a person to make an offer of the kind referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Regulation, a specified licensee is to be regarded as supplying a service through a SIM card if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensee has offered a telecommunications service; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: under the agreement, arrangement or understanding mentioned in subsection (1)(a) arising from the offering of the service, the service is provided through the SIM card by—

subparagraph.content: the licensee; or
the other person mentioned in subsection (1)(a)(ii).

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Regulation, a reference to a service agreement in relation to a SIM card is a reference to the agreement, arrangement or understanding mentioned in subsection (2)(b).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Meaning of eligible person

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Regulation, each of the following is taken to be an eligible person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual acting in his or her individual capacity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an individual acting in the capacity as the holder of a relevant certificate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a body acting in the capacity as the holder of a relevant certificate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a body that does not hold a relevant certificate.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(a) and (b), if an individual has more than one of the following capacities—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: his or her individual capacity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the capacity as the holder of a relevant certificate or (if the individual holds more than one relevant certificate) of each relevant certificate,

subsection.continued: then in respect of each capacity in which the individual is acting, the individual is taken to be a separate eligible person.

subsection.content: For subsection (1)(c), if a body holds more than one relevant certificate, then in respect of each capacity in which the body is acting as the holder of a relevant certificate, the body is taken to be a separate eligible person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant certificate (有關登記證) means a valid business registration certificate or valid branch registration certificate.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Specified licensee to ensure that SIM card is not active unless currently registered

subsection.content: A specified licensee who supplies, or is to supply, a service through a SIM card must ensure that the SIM card is not active unless the SIM card is currently registered with the licensee.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the SIM card is active solely for the purpose of facilitating registration of the SIM card under section 6.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Registration of SIM card for eligible person

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a specified licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may register a service plan SIM card for any eligible person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may register a pre-paid SIM card for any eligible person mentioned in section 4(1)(a), (b) or (c).

subsection.leadIn: A specified licensee may register a SIM card for an eligible person only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has provided the licensee with all the specified information of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the licensee has no reasonable cause to believe that the specified information is—

subparagraph.content: incomplete or contradictory; or
false or misleading in a material respect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a pre-paid SIM card—the registration will not result in a contravention of section 7.

subsection.content: The eligible person’s specified information must be provided in a way that is specified by the specified licensee in accordance with the guidelines.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Maximum number of pre-paid SIM cards for eligible person
section.leadIn: A specified licensee must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for each eligible person mentioned in section 4(1)(b) or (c)—the person has no more than 25 pre-paid SIM cards that are currently registered with the licensee.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Deregistration of SIM card on cessation of service
section.content: A specified licensee may deregister a SIM card that is currently registered with the licensee if the licensee has ceased to supply any service through the SIM card.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Deregistration of SIM card in case of irregularity

subsection.leadIn: A specified licensee must deregister a SIM card that is currently registered with the licensee for an eligible person if the licensee has reasonable cause to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the current specified information of the eligible person contained in the SIM card record is—

subparagraph.content: incomplete or contradictory; or
false or misleading in a material respect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a pre-paid SIM card—the registration of the SIM card has contravened section 7.

subsection.leadIn: However, before the specified licensee deregisters a SIM card under subsection (1)(a) or (b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensee must take reasonable steps to allow the eligible person to rectify the circumstance mentioned in that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licensee is not required to deregister the SIM card if the person rectifies the circumstance within a reasonable time.

subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (1)(a)(i), the current specified information of an eligible person becomes incomplete for the purposes of that subsection if, at the time immediately after a correction is made to the information, the information as corrected does not cover all the specified information pertaining to the person at that time.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Deregistration of SIM card on eligible person’s request

subsection.content: An eligible person for whom a SIM card is currently registered with a specified licensee may request the licensee to deregister it.
The request must be made in a way that is specified by the specified licensee in accordance with the guidelines.
The specified licensee must deregister the SIM card as soon as practicable after receiving the request.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Keeping of SIM card record

subsection.leadIn: A specified licensee must keep a record in respect of a SIM card during—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period in which the SIM card is currently registered with the licensee for an eligible person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period of 1 year after the end of the period mentioned in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: The record must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an identifier of the SIM card (such as the mobile phone number assigned to the SIM card); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the current specified information of the eligible person.

subsection.content: The record must be kept in hard copy form or in electronic form (or in both) in accordance with the guidelines.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Provision of SIM card record to law enforcement officer under warrant

subsection.leadIn: If a magistrate is satisfied by information on oath that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is reasonable cause to suspect that an offence has been, is being, or is about to be committed, and it is necessary to obtain a SIM card record for the purpose of investigating or preventing the offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is necessary to obtain a SIM card record for the purpose of preventing loss of life of, or serious bodily harm to, any person,

subsection.continued: the magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing any law enforcement officer to require the specified licensee that keeps the record to provide the record.

subsection.content: The specified licensee must provide the SIM card record in compliance with the warrant.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Provision of SIM card record to law enforcement officer not under warrant

subsection.leadIn: If a law enforcement officer of a senior rank is satisfied—

subparagraph.content: there is reasonable cause to suspect that a serious offence has been, is being, or is about to be committed, and it is necessary to obtain a SIM card record for the purpose of investigating or preventing the offence; or
a delay caused by an application for a warrant under section 12(1) is likely to defeat the purpose of obtaining the record mentioned in paragraph (a); or
for any reason it is not reasonably practicable to make such an application,

subsection.continued: the officer may authorize in writing any law enforcement officer to require the specified licensee that keeps the record to provide the record.

subsection.content: The specified licensee must provide the SIM card record as soon as practicable after being required to do so by a law enforcement officer authorized under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SeniorRank
def.leadIn: senior rank (高級) means a rank not below the rank of—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in relation to an officer of the Hong Kong Police Force—Superintendent of Police;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to an officer of the Immigration Department—Assistant Principal Immigration Officer; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to an officer of the Independent Commission Against Corruption—Commission Against Corruption Officer (Upper);

def.name: SeriousOffence
def.leadIn: serious offence (嚴重罪行) means an offence punishable by a maximum penalty that is or includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a term of imprisonment of not less than 3 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a fine of not less than $1,000,000.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Guidelines
section.leadIn: Without limiting section 6D of the Ordinance, the Authority may issue guidelines on how specified licensees—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: collect and verify an eligible person’s specified information;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: register or deregister a SIM card;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: keep or provide a SIM card record under Part 4; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: carry out the transitional arrangements provided for in Part 6.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Inspection

subsection.content: The Authority may, on giving reasonable prior written notice to a specified licensee, enter and inspect any office, premises or place in Hong Kong that is or are used by the licensee in any way (including by installing a facility in it or them) for the purpose of compliance with this Regulation, to verify that the licensee is complying with this Regulation.
The specified licensee must provide any assistance reasonably required by the Authority for the inspection.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 6
section.def: commencement date (生效日期) means 1 March 2022;

def.name: ExistingInformation
def.leadIn: existing information (原有資料), in relation to an existing user, means—

paragraph.name: a
b

section.def: existing pre-paid SIM card (原有儲值卡) means a pre-paid SIM card where the specified licensee concerned has provided or given (whether or not by way of sale) the SIM card, or the right to use the SIM card, to another person immediately before the commencement date;

def.name: ExistingServicePlanSIMCard
def.leadIn: existing service plan SIM card (原有服務計劃卡)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a service plan SIM card provided by a specified licensee where the service agreement relating to the SIM card was in force immediately before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b

section.def: specified information (指明資料), in relation to an existing user, has a meaning that is the same as its meaning in relation to an eligible person.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Transitional arrangement—existing pre-paid SIM cards
section.content: Until 23 February 2023 (inclusive of that date), section 5 does not apply to a specified licensee in respect of an existing pre-paid SIM card provided by the licensee.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Transitional arrangement—existing service plan SIM cards

subsection.leadIn: Section 5 does not apply to a specified licensee in respect of an existing service plan SIM card provided by the licensee during the period (service period)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning with the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ending when the licensee ceases to supply any service through the SIM card to the existing user.

subsection.leadIn: If the existing service plan SIM card is active at any time during the service period (but is not currently registered with the specified licensee by virtue of subsection (1)), the licensee must keep a record that contains—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an identifier of the SIM card (such as the mobile phone number assigned to the SIM card); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the existing information of the existing user (as it may be corrected from time to time),

subsection.continued: until the expiry of 1 year after the end of the service period.

subsection.content: The record mentioned in subsection (2) must be kept in hard copy form or in electronic form (or in both) in accordance with the guidelines.

If the specified licensee receives, during the service period, any part of the specified information of the existing user that has not yet been included in the record kept under subsection (2) (additional information), the additional information must be included in the record.
The record kept under subsection (2), including any additional information, is taken to be a SIM card record for the purposes of this Regulation.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Individual aged 16 or above

subsection.leadIn: If the eligible person is an individual acting in his or her individual capacity who is aged 16 or above and holds an identity card, the information specified for the person is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following information as shown on the identity card—

subparagraph.content: the number of the identity card;
the person’s full name in English;
(if applicable) the person’s full name in Chinese; and
the person’s date of birth; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the identity card.

subsection.leadIn: If the eligible person is an individual acting in his or her individual capacity who is aged 16 or above and does not hold an identity card, the information specified for the person is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following information as shown on a valid identification document of the person—

subparagraph.content: the number of the identification document;
the person’s full name in English;
(if applicable) the person’s full name in Chinese; and
the person’s date of birth;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: a statement to the effect that the person does not hold an identity card.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Individual aged below 16
section.leadIn: If the eligible person is an individual acting in his or her individual capacity who is aged below 16, the information specified for the person is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the person does not hold an identity card—the information mentioned in section 1(2)(a), (b) and (c) of this Schedule in respect of the person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the following information in respect of an individual who is aged 18 or above (adult)—

subparagraph.content: if the adult does not hold an identity card—the information mentioned in section 1(2)(a), (b) and (c) of this Schedule in respect of the adult; and
a statement of the relationship between the adult and the eligible person.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Business or branch of business
section.leadIn: If the eligible person is an individual or a body acting in the capacity of the holder of a valid business registration certificate or valid branch registration certificate, the information specified for the person is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following information as shown on the certificate—

subparagraph.content: the number of the certificate;
(if applicable) the name of business or corporation in English;
(if applicable) the name of business or corporation in Chinese;
(if applicable) the business or branch name in English; and
(if applicable) the business or branch name in Chinese;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the certificate or of a duplicate of the certificate (within the meaning of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310)); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the following information in respect of an individual aged 18 or above named as the responsible person of the eligible person—

subparagraph.content: if the individual holds an identity card—the information mentioned in section 1(1)(a) and (b) of this Schedule in respect of the individual; or
if the individual does not hold an identity card—the information mentioned in section 1(2)(a), (b) and (c) of this Schedule in respect of the individual.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Body not holding valid business registration certificate or valid branch registration certificate
section.leadIn: If the eligible person is a body that does not hold any valid business registration certificate or valid branch registration certificate, the information specified for the person is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the body in English or Chinese (or both); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the following information in respect of an individual aged 18 or above named as the responsible person of the body—

subparagraph.content: if the individual holds an identity card—the information mentioned in section 1(1)(a) and (b) of this Schedule in respect of the individual; or
if the individual does not hold an identity card—the information mentioned in section 1(2)(a), (b) and (c) of this Schedule in respect of the individual.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: Cap. 115 (《第115章》) means the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115);
Cap. 177 (《第177章》) means the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person appointed under section 2 of Cap. 177 to be the Commissioner of Registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person appointed under that section to be the Deputy Commissioner of Registration; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person appointed under that section to be an assistant commissioner of registration;

def.name: IdentificationDocument
def.leadIn: identification document (身分證明文件), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a document issued by the Commissioner acknowledging that the person has applied—

subparagraph.content: to be registered under Cap. 177; or
for a new identity card under regulation 13 or 14 of the Registration of Persons Regulations (Cap. 177 sub. leg. A);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a travel document (as defined by section 2(1) of Cap. 115) held by the person;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
paragraph.content: a document issued under section 36(1) of Cap. 115 acknowledging that the person has entered into a recognizance;

subsection.def: identity card (身分證) has the meaning given by section 1A(1) of Cap. 177.

subsection.content: In this Schedule, a reference to a name in English includes a name in characters of the Latin alphabet.
